Class InputSource2Utils

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.object.StatelessObject
      com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.input.InputSource2Utils
All Implemented Interfaces:
IInputSource2Utils
@FullyTested
public final class InputSource2Utils
extends StatelessObject
implements IInputSource2Utils

Static utilities for InputSource2. To use the methods in this class create a new instance via InputSource2Utils() or use the public static member INSTANCE.

Author:
Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)
See Also:
INSTANCE, StatelessObject, IInputSource2Utils

checkValid

public void checkValid(InputSource2 inputSource,
                       String argName)
Tests if an InputSource2 has exactly one byte- or character-stream.

Parameters:
inputSource - an input source reference
argName - argument name for inputSource, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"

checkValid

public void checkValid(Collection<? extends InputSource2> inputSourceCollection,
                       String argName)
Tests if a Collection of InputSource2 is not empty and has valid elements (non-null, and each with exactly one byte- or character-stream).

Specified by:
checkValid in interface IInputSource2Utils
Parameters:
inputSourceCollection - a collection of input sources reference
argName - argument name for inputSourceCollection, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
See Also:
IInputSource2Utils.checkValid(InputSource2, String)
